answers.answer: I'm not a parent, but I do know that when I was diagnosed I had major headaches and stomach aches. But I doubt its type one diabetes because peeing a lot is how the body is trying to get rid of the excess sugar... and also you're really overly fatigued because all your sugar is staying in your blood and not going into your cells..but it can't hurt getting tested. It could be a different form of diabetes, there's more than just type one and two.Hope that helps :]

question: Just wondering if anyone's child who has been diagnosed with JD ,, was one of the symptoms constant tummy aches?? Headaches? I am gathering data/symptoms to bring to our GP to see if my son (age 10) could be tested to check for diabetes,, he has missed quite a bit of school due to headaches and tummy aches this year. Plus he eats a lot, drinks a lot,, not sure about the peeing a lot. He is thin and rather hyper... as well.. any suggestions?thanksJ
title: juvenile diabetes symptoms
